body:
I tried that one but it does not have any effect.
I also tried deleting my alacritty config file, so a new one gets generated in case something was mistyped.
It has this setting defaulted to false, but it still copies.

I'm not aware of this issue, potentially there was some mistake in the Windows implementation.

@zacps can you reproduce this issue?

issue.title: Windows: Focus with mouse highlights text
issue.body:
Operating System: Windows
Pretty sure this doesn't happen in Linux.

### Behavior summary
When focusing the window with a mouse click, all characters are highlighted up until the character clicked on.

### Expectation
The window is simply focused, no extra selection occurs.

### Extra
This is especially irritating in combination with #2050.
(`selection: save_to_clipboard: false` doesn't seem to work, resulting in pasting half the terminal screen back into the prompt)

issue.title: Fix selection copying on Windows
issue.body:
The `copypasta` crate incorrectly mapped the secondary clipboard on
Windows to the primary clipboard, leading to the primary clipboard
getting overwritten whenever the selection clipboard was updated.

The new Windows clipboard mimics the macOS clipboard, which also does
not have a selection clipboard.

This fixes #2050.
